'''What is good software to manage a classroom of Ubuntu computers:''' 

'''Description:''' 
There are various tasks involved in managing a ComputerLab.  However, these tasks are reduced if one uses ThinClients.  As a teacher I need to be able to
* see any students desktop from mine, allowing me to sole or shared control of the student's computer.
* very easily text with individuals as needed
* copying files to and from a user's desktop on the fly
* list view of applications currently active on student sessions
* list of computer hardware specs.
This kind of software often allows one to add users to groups, then groups are managed.  In the Mac world this software is called, Apple Remote Desktop:
<nowiki>[[http://store.apple.com/us_edu_47679/product/MB423Z/A?fnode=home/shop_mac/software/apple&mco=MTA4MDM4]]</nowiki>
